Media outlets reported on a dire warning: 2. The Daily Mail initially reported that health experts had predicted the virus could kill 65 million people in a year, but later issued a correction and updated their article.
The claim was prompted by a mock pandemi: run by Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security in October 2019. However, this exercise did not predict the current virus would kill 65 million people.
Johns Hopkins Center for Health Security: They emphasized that the exercise was meant to highlight preparedness and response challenges in a severe pandemic.
